p: In contrast to B. erectus, B. hordeaceus had a fast-grower’s life strategy and grew twice as fast, had doubled NP max and significantly higher SLA at 20 °C with FA conditions. This also displays the invasive character of B. hordeaceus, because invasive alien species are known to have higher values for performance-related traits than non‐invasive species [ 56]. The following section highlights the differences in the reaction norm to changes in growth temperature, nutrient supply and their combinations for B. hordeaceus in comparison to the slow-growing B. erectus.
